credential_reuse.title: Password Reuse Attacks
credential_reuse.threat: Prevent a leaked password from one account being used to log into another
credential_reuse.description: When hackers breach one website and steal passwords, they immediately try those same passwords on other popular sites. If you reuse passwords, one breach can cascade into multiple account compromises.
credential_reuse.impact: Account takeover, identity theft, financial loss
examples: A gaming site gets hacked, exposing your password
Hackers try that password on your email, bank, and social media
They gain access to accounts where you reused the password

physical_access.title: Physical Device Access
physical_access.threat: Prevent unauthorized access when your device is unattended or stolen
physical_access.description: Unlocked devices are like open doors - anyone who finds or steals your device can access your personal information, accounts, and sensitive data instantly.
physical_access.impact: Data theft, account compromise, privacy violation
examples: Someone picks up your unlocked phone at a coffee shop
A thief steals your laptop and accesses your saved passwords
A coworker looks through your computer while you're away

account_takeover.title: Account Hijacking
account_takeover.threat: Prevent attackers from taking control of your most important accounts
account_takeover.description: Your email and financial accounts are the keys to your digital life. If compromised, attackers can reset passwords, steal money, and impersonate you.
account_takeover.impact: Complete identity theft, financial loss, reputation damage
examples: Attacker gains email access and resets all your other passwords
Someone drains your bank account or makes unauthorized purchases
Your identity is used for fraud or to scam your contacts

malware_infection.title: Malware & Virus Attacks
malware_infection.threat: Prevent malicious software from infecting and controlling your device
malware_infection.description: Malware can steal passwords, spy on your activities, encrypt your files for ransom, or turn your device into part of a criminal network.
malware_infection.impact: Data theft, ransomware, device hijacking, financial loss
examples: Ransomware encrypts all your files and demands payment
Spyware records your keystrokes and steals passwords
Your device is used to attack other computers without you knowing

data_theft.title: Data Theft & Privacy Loss
data_theft.threat: Prevent personal information from being stolen or exposed
data_theft.description: Your personal data, photos, documents, and private communications can be stolen and used for blackmail, fraud, or sold on the dark web.
examples: Private photos or messages are stolen and used for blackmail
Personal documents are used to commit identity fraud
Your data is sold to criminals or used for targeted attacks

network_attacks.title: Network-Based Attacks
network_attacks.threat: Prevent attackers from intercepting your internet traffic or gaining network access
network_attacks.description: Unsecured network connections allow attackers to spy on your online activities, steal login credentials, or inject malicious content.
network_attacks.impact: Data interception, credential theft, man-in-the-middle attacks
examples: Someone on public WiFi intercepts your passwords
Attackers redirect you to fake websites that steal your information
Your internet traffic is monitored and personal information collected

malicious_ads.title: Malicious Advertising & Fake Sites
malicious_ads.threat: Prevent ads and fake websites from tricking you into dangerous actions
malicious_ads.description: Malicious ads can redirect you to fake websites that steal your information, install malware, or trick you into downloading harmful software. Even legitimate sites can host dangerous ads.
malicious_ads.impact: Malware infection, credential theft, financial fraud
examples: A fake 'Download' button actually installs malware
An ad redirects you to a fake bank login page that steals your credentials
Pop-up ads claiming your computer is infected trick you into downloading 'antivirus' malware
